title: XPoSat Satellite Launch
description: India successfully launched the XPoSat satellite to study cosmic X-rays.

title: Luna 1 Launched
description: The USSR launched Luna 1, the first spacecraft to reach the vicinity of the Moon.

title: Chang'e 4 Moon Landing
description: China's Chang'e 4 became the first spacecraft to land on the far side of the Moon.

title: Spirit Rover Lands on Mars
description: NASA's Spirit rover landed on Mars, beginning its exploration of the Martian surface.

title: NASA Announces Shuttle Program
description: President Nixon announced the development of NASA's Space Shuttle program.

title: Luna 9 Launch
description: The USSR launched Luna 9, which later became the first spacecraft to achieve a soft landing on the Moon.

title: Galileo Discovers Jupiter's Moons
description: Galileo Galilei observed three of Jupiter's moons for the first time through his telescope.

title: INSAT-3C Launched
description: India launched INSAT-3C to provide communication services across the Indian region.

title: First Discovery of Exoplanets
description: Two planets were discovered orbiting the pulsar PSR B1257+12, marking the first confirmed detection of exoplanets.

title: First Satellite from India Tracked
description: India tracked an American satellite for the first time, marking early involvement in global space activity.

title: PSLV-C10 Launch
description: ISRO launched the PSLV-C10 carrying the Israeli TecSAR satellite.

title: INSAT-3A Launch
description: ISRO launched INSAT-3A for telecommunications, television broadcasting, and weather forecasting.

title: INSAT-2B Launched
description: India launched INSAT-2B, a multipurpose satellite for meteorology and telecommunications.

title: Huygens Lands on Titan
description: ESA's Huygens probe landed on Saturn's moon Titan, transmitting data about its surface.

title: Stardust Returns to Earth
description: NASA’s Stardust mission returned with dust samples from comet Wild 2.

title: Final Launch of Space Shuttle Columbia
description: Space Shuttle Columbia launched for its final mission STS-107, which ended in tragedy.

title: ISRO PSLV-C1 Launch
description: ISRO successfully launched PSLV-C1 carrying IRS-1D, improving India's Earth observation capabilities.

title: Launch of SPOT-1
description: France launched SPOT-1, a satellite for Earth observation.

title: New Horizons Launch
description: NASA launched New Horizons on a mission to study Pluto and the Kuiper Belt.

title: India-US Space Agreement
description: India and USA signed an agreement for cooperation in civil space activities.

title: Little Joe 1B Launch
description: NASA launched Little Joe 1B to test the Mercury capsule escape system.

title: INSAT-3C Launch
description: ISRO launched INSAT-3C for improved telecommunications across India.

title: ISRO PSLV-C2 Launch
description: India launched PSLV-C2 carrying IRS-P4 and two foreign satellites, highlighting global collaboration.

title: Voyager 2 Flyby of Uranus
description: NASA's Voyager 2 made its closest approach to Uranus, sending back the first close-up images.

title: India Launches Cartosat-2
description: ISRO launched Cartosat-2 for high-resolution Earth observation.

title: Republic Day Honours Indian Space Scientists
description: Notable space scientists awarded Padma honors for contributions to ISRO.

title: Apollo 1 Tragedy
description: Fire during a pre-launch test killed all three Apollo 1 astronauts.

title: Challenger Disaster
description: NASA's Space Shuttle Challenger broke apart shortly after launch, killing all seven astronauts.

title: ISRO Launches SROSS-A
description: India launched the first satellite in the SROSS series to study X-rays and gamma rays.

title: Opportunity Rover Lands on Mars
description: NASA's Opportunity rover successfully landed on Mars to continue the exploration started by Spirit.

title: Super Blue Blood Moon
description: A rare celestial event combining a supermoon, blue moon, and lunar eclipse.

title: Columbia Shuttle Disaster
description: NASA's Space Shuttle Columbia disintegrated upon re-entry, killing all seven astronauts on board.

title: Iran Launches Omid Satellite
description: Iran successfully launched its first domestically made satellite, Omid, into orbit.

title: Luna 9 Lands on Moon
description: The USSR's Luna 9 became the first spacecraft to achieve a soft landing on the Moon.

title: Rosetta Launched
description: ESA launched the Rosetta spacecraft to study comet 67P/Churyumov–Gerasimenko.

title: Apollo 14 Moon Landing
description: Apollo 14 astronauts Alan Shepard and Edgar Mitchell landed on the Moon.

title: India's GSAT-4 Launch Failure
description: India's GSAT-4 satellite launch failed due to cryogenic stage malfunction.

title: STS-98 Launch
description: NASA launched Space Shuttle Atlantis on mission STS-98 to deliver Destiny lab to the ISS.

title: GSAT-14 Launched
description: ISRO successfully launched GSAT-14 using the GSLV Mk II with an indigenous cryogenic engine.

title: Galileo Flyby of Venus
description: NASA's Galileo spacecraft conducted a flyby of Venus to gain speed for its journey to Jupiter.

title: First Satellite Collision
description: An Iridium communication satellite and a defunct Russian satellite collided in orbit.

title: Solar Dynamics Observatory Launch
description: NASA launched the Solar Dynamics Observatory to study the Sun.

title: NEAR Shoemaker Lands on Asteroid
description: NASA's NEAR Shoemaker became the first spacecraft to land on an asteroid (Eros).

title: ISRO Unveils Human Spaceflight Training
description: ISRO announced Gaganyaan astronaut training had begun in collaboration with Russia.

title: Voyager 1's Pale Blue Dot Photo
description: NASA's Voyager 1 captured the famous Pale Blue Dot photo of Earth from 6 billion km away.

title: Chelyabinsk Meteor
description: A meteor exploded over Chelyabinsk, Russia, injuring over 1,000 people and shocking the world.

title: IRS-1E Launched
description: India launched IRS-1E for remote sensing, but the mission failed due to rocket malfunction.

title: Vanguard 2 Launched
description: USA launched Vanguard 2, the first weather satellite, to measure cloud cover.

title: Perseverance Rover Lands on Mars
description: NASA's Perseverance rover successfully landed on Mars to search for signs of ancient life.

title: Mir Space Station Launched
description: The USSR launched the core module of the Mir space station into orbit.

title: John Glenn Orbits Earth
description: John Glenn became the first American to orbit the Earth aboard Friendship 7.

title: ISRO Launches PSLV-C10
description: ISRO successfully launched PSLV-C10 carrying an Israeli satellite, strengthening international ties.

title: TRAPPIST-1 Discovery
description: NASA announced discovery of seven Earth-sized planets orbiting the TRAPPIST-1 star.

title: India Launches PSLV-C45
description: ISRO launched PSLV-C45 carrying EMISAT and 28 international customer satellites.

title: Mariner 6 Launch
description: NASA launched Mariner 6 to fly by Mars and send back close-up images.

title: INSAT-4B Launched
description: India launched INSAT-4B for communication services and television broadcasting.

title: ISRO Launches PSLV-C19
description: India successfully launched PSLV-C19 carrying RISAT-1, a radar imaging satellite.

title: India's GSLV Mk III First Test
description: India conducted a successful suborbital test of GSLV Mk III, marking a milestone for heavier payload launches.

title: Discovery Launches STS-62
description: Space Shuttle Discovery launched STS-62 for microgravity and atmospheric research.

title: India Launches IRNSS-1F
description: ISRO launched IRNSS-1F, part of the Indian Regional Navigation Satellite System (IRNSS).

title: Venera 3 Crash-Lands on Venus
description: The Soviet Union’s Venera 3 becomes the first human-made object to impact another planet.

title: Launch of Pioneer 10
description: NASA launched Pioneer 10, the first spacecraft to travel through the asteroid belt and make direct observations of Jupiter.

title: ISRO PSLV-C5 Launch
description: India launched PSLV-C5 carrying the Cartosat-1 and HAMSAT satellites.

title: MRO Enters Mars Orbit
description: NASA’s Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter entered orbit around Mars to begin its study of the red planet.

title: ISRO's Indo-French SARAL Mission
description: India and France jointly launched the SARAL satellite for oceanographic studies.

title: Launch of Kepler Telescope
description: NASA launched the Kepler Space Telescope to discover Earth-like planets orbiting other stars.

title: INSAT Program Announced
description: India formally announced the creation of the Indian National Satellite System (INSAT).

title: Giotto Flyby of Halley’s Comet
description: ESA's Giotto spacecraft makes its closest approach to Halley’s Comet.

title: First Indian Rocket Test
description: India conducted one of its earliest rocket tests from Thumba Equatorial Rocket Launching Station.

title: MESSENGER Enters Mercury Orbit
description: NASA's MESSENGER became the first spacecraft to orbit Mercury.

title: Mir Space Station Deorbited
description: Russia deorbited the Mir space station after 15 years in orbit.

title: INSAT-3B Launch
description: ISRO launched INSAT-3B for telecommunications and internet services.

title: ISRO’s PSLV-C3 Mission
description: India launched PSLV-C3 carrying the TES and two foreign satellites.

title: Discovery of Neptune's Largest Ring
description: Astronomers discovered a massive ring system around Neptune using ground-based telescopes.

title: Mission Shakti
description: India successfully tested its first anti-satellite missile, demonstrating space defense capability.

title: ISRO Launches Cartosat-1
description: India launched Cartosat-1 for high-resolution Earth observation.

title: Mangalyaan Project Approved
description: India approved its first interplanetary mission to Mars, later named Mangalyaan.

title: First Weather Satellite Launched
description: NASA launched TIROS-1, the first successful weather satellite.

title: Rakesh Sharma Goes to Space
description: Rakesh Sharma became the first Indian to travel to space aboard Soyuz T-11.

title: Mars Odyssey Launched
description: NASA launched Mars Odyssey to map the Martian surface and find signs of water.

title: ISRO PSLV-C3 Launch
description: India launched PSLV-C3 carrying three satellites including TES and BIRD.

title: NASA Announces Mercury 7 Astronauts
description: NASA introduced the original seven astronauts for the Mercury program.

title: Apollo 13 Launches
description: NASA launched Apollo 13, which later faced a critical failure en route to the Moon.

title: Yuri Gagarin's Historic Flight
description: Yuri Gagarin became the first human in space aboard Vostok 1.

title: First Space Shuttle Flight
description: NASA launched the first reusable Space Shuttle, Columbia (STS-1).

title: Cartosat-2A and IMS-1 Launched
description: ISRO launched Cartosat-2A and IMS-1 along with eight foreign nanosatellites.

title: Apollo 13 Returns Safely
description: Apollo 13 splashed down safely after surviving a near-disaster in space.

title: Salyut 1 Launched
description: The Soviet Union launched the first space station, Salyut 1.

title: RISAT-2 Launch
description: ISRO launched RISAT-2, India’s first radar imaging satellite for all-weather surveillance.

title: ISRO PSLV-C12 Launch
description: India launched PSLV-C12 carrying RISAT-2 and ANUSAT.

title: Hubble Space Telescope Launched
description: NASA launched the Hubble Space Telescope aboard Space Shuttle Discovery.

title: Ariane Launch System Initiated
description: The European Space Agency initiated development of the Ariane launch vehicle family.

title: ISRO Launches Cartosat-2A
description: India launched Cartosat-2A, a high-resolution remote sensing satellite.

title: Dennis Tito Becomes First Space Tourist
description: American businessman Dennis Tito flew to space aboard a Russian Soyuz mission.

title: Cartosat-2 Launched
description: India launched Cartosat-2, enhancing its Earth observation capabilities.

title: Chandrayaan-1's Moon Impact Probe Discovery
description: India's Chandrayaan-1 confirmed the presence of magnesium, aluminum, and silicon on the Moon.

title: Luna 5 Launch
description: The USSR launched Luna 5 in an attempt to achieve a soft landing on the Moon.

title: Chang’e-6 Lunar Mission Launch
description: China launched the Chang’e-6 mission to collect samples from the Moon's far side.

title: Magellan Mission Launch
description: NASA launched the Magellan spacecraft to map the surface of Venus using radar.

title: Alan Shepard Flies Freedom 7
description: Alan Shepard became the first American in space aboard Freedom 7.

title: ISRO Launches GSAT-2
description: India launched GSAT-2, an experimental communication satellite.

title: Endeavour’s First Flight
description: The space shuttle Endeavour launched on its maiden voyage, STS-49.

title: Ariel 1 Launch
description: The first British satellite, Ariel 1, was launched into orbit.

title: Hayabusa Launched
description: Japan launched Hayabusa to bring back samples from asteroid Itokawa.

title: Lunar Orbiter 4 Launch
description: NASA launched Lunar Orbiter 4 to photograph the Moon's surface for Apollo landing site selection.

title: STS-125 Launch
description: NASA launched the final Hubble servicing mission via space shuttle Atlantis.

title: India Launches GSAT-1
description: GSAT-1 was India’s first experimental geo-stationary satellite for digital audio broadcasting.

title: Discoverer 13 Recovery
description: First successful recovery of a capsule from orbit by the Discoverer program.

title: Skylab Launch
description: NASA launched Skylab, the United States' first space station.

title: Sputnik 3 Launch
description: The USSR launched Sputnik 3 to study Earth's upper atmosphere and cosmic rays.

title: Venera 5 Reaches Venus
description: USSR’s Venera 5 transmitted data from Venus's atmosphere.

title: Venera 6 Reaches Venus
description: Venera 6 followed Venera 5 with similar objectives on Venus.

title: Helen Sharman Flies to Mir
description: First Briton in space, Helen Sharman flew to the Mir Space Station.

title: ISRO Launches RISAT-2
description: India launched RISAT-2 for all-weather remote sensing using radar.

title: ISRO Launches Cartosat-2B
description: High-resolution Earth observation satellite launched by India.

title: Spektr Module Launched
description: Russia launched the Spektr science module to Mir.

title: Apollo 10 Orbits Moon
description: NASA's Apollo 10 lunar module orbited the Moon as a rehearsal for Apollo 11.

title: Phoenix Mars Lander Reaches Mars
description: NASA’s Phoenix successfully landed on Mars's polar region.

title: Aurora 7 Launch
description: NASA launched Scott Carpenter aboard Aurora 7 for America’s second manned orbital flight.

title: Herschel and Planck Start Operations
description: ESA’s Herschel Space Observatory and Planck telescope began operations to study cosmic radiation.

title: STS-96 Launch
description: Space Shuttle Discovery launched and became the first shuttle to dock with the ISS.

title: Mars 2 Orbiter Reaches Mars
description: USSR’s Mars 2 became the first spacecraft to reach Mars’s surface, though crash-landed.

title: Beagle 2 Launched
description: The British Beagle 2 Mars lander was launched on ESA’s Mars Express.

title: Chandrayaan-1 Mission Approval
description: ISRO approved India’s first lunar mission, Chandrayaan-1.

title: India's GSAT-6A Launched
description: ISRO launched GSAT-6A for mobile communication.

title: SpaceX Launches SES-12
description: SpaceX Falcon 9 launched SES-12 communications satellite.

title: Formation of Caltech Rocket Research Project
description: Theodore von Kármán established the Caltech Rocket Research Project, the precursor to NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL).

title: Launch of Mars Express
description: The European Space Agency (ESA) launched Mars Express, its first mission to the Red Planet.

title: First Moon Relay of a Message
description: Scientists used the Moon to relay a transmission of President Eisenhower's message from the USA to Canada.

title: Maiden Flight of SpaceX Falcon 9
description: SpaceX successfully launched the Falcon 9 rocket on its maiden flight from Cape Canaveral.

title: Reactivation of Hubble's NICMOS
description: After more than three years of inactivity, Hubble's Near Infrared Camera and Multi-Object Spectrometer (NICMOS) was reactivated.

title: Annular Solar Eclipse Observed
description: An annular solar eclipse was visible across parts of the Americas, offering a spectacular 'ring of fire' effect.

title: Discovery of Planet-Forming Disk
description: Astronomers announced the discovery of a planet-forming disk around the young star Oph-IRS 48.

title: Birth of Giovanni Cassini
description: Giovanni Cassini, notable for his work in astronomy and for whom the Cassini spacecraft was named, was born.

title: Publication of Einstein's Quantum Theory Analysis
description: Albert Einstein published his analysis of Planck's quantum theory and its application to light.

title: Launch of NASA's Spirit Rover
description: NASA launched the Spirit rover as part of its Mars Exploration Rover mission.

title: Ignite Space 2024 Conference Begins
description: The Ignite Space 2024 conference commenced in Leeds, focusing on commercial opportunities in the UK space industry.

title: Launch of Venera 4
description: The USSR launched Venera 4, a probe that became the first to directly analyze the atmosphere of another planet (Venus).

title: Thurgood Marshall Nominated to Supreme Court
description: President Lyndon B. Johnson nominated Thurgood Marshall to become the first Black justice on the U.S. Supreme Court.

title: First Monkey in Space
description: Albert II became the first monkey to travel to space aboard a V-2 rocket.

title: Instant Expert: Decoding the Cosmos Event
description: Conway Hall in London hosted an event aimed at demystifying cosmic phenomena for the public.

title: Valentina Tereshkova Becomes First Woman in Space
description: Valentina Tereshkova flew aboard Vostok 6, becoming the first woman to travel into space.

title: Soviet Luna 17 Mission Launch
description: The USSR launched Luna 17, which carried the Lunokhod 1 rover to the Moon.

title: Sally Ride Becomes First American Woman in Space
description: Sally Ride flew aboard Space Shuttle Challenger on mission STS-7, becoming the first American woman in space.

title: Kuwait Joins the United Nations
description: Kuwait became the 111th member of the United Nations.

title: Hubble Space Telescope Sends First Images
description: NASA's Hubble Space Telescope sent its first images back to Earth.

title: SpaceShipOne's First Flight
description: SpaceShipOne became the first privately funded spacecraft to achieve spaceflight.

title: Full Strawberry Moon
description: The Full Moon in June, known as the Strawberry Moon, reached its peak, offering a bright display in the night sky.

title: Launch of Cartosat-2 Series Satellite
description: ISRO launched the Cartosat-2 series satellite along with 30 co-passenger satellites aboard PSLV-C38.

title: Launch of SVOM Satellite
description: China and France jointly launched the SVOM satellite to observe gamma-ray bursts and other high-energy cosmic events.

title: Chang'e-6 Returns with Lunar Samples
description: China's Chang'e-6 mission returned to Earth with the first-ever samples collected from the Moon's far side.

title: India Space Congress 2024 Begins
description: The India Space Congress 2024 commenced in New Delhi, focusing on global collaboration and innovation in the space sector.

title: June Bootids Meteor Shower Peaks
description: The June Bootids meteor shower reached its peak, offering a display of meteors in the night sky.

title: Conclusion of India Space Congress 2024
description: The India Space Congress 2024 concluded, marking the end of discussions on advancing space technology and cooperation.

title: Moon Reaches Last Quarter Phase
description: The Moon entered its last quarter phase, visible prominently in the predawn sky.

title: Saturn Enters Retrograde Motion
description: Saturn began its apparent retrograde motion, an optical illusion observed from Earth.

title: Cassini Enters Saturn Orbit
description: NASA's Cassini spacecraft successfully entered orbit around Saturn, beginning detailed study of the planet and its moons.

title: First Pulsar Discovery Published
description: The discovery of the first pulsar, PSR B1919+21, was officially published in 'Nature', revolutionizing astrophysics.

title: Mariner 4 Closest Approach to Mars
description: NASA's Mariner 4 made its closest approach to Mars, capturing the first close-up images of another planet.

title: Deep Impact Hits Comet Tempel 1
description: NASA's Deep Impact spacecraft intentionally collided with Comet Tempel 1 to study its composition.

title: Juno Arrives at Jupiter
description: NASA’s Juno spacecraft entered orbit around Jupiter to study its atmosphere and magnetic field.

title: Mars Pathfinder Rover Deploys
description: NASA’s Sojourner rover began operations after deploying from the Mars Pathfinder lander.

title: Mars Odyssey Begins Mapping
description: NASA's 2001 Mars Odyssey orbiter began its science mapping mission.

title: Final Space Shuttle Launch
description: NASA launched Space Shuttle Atlantis on STS-135, the final mission of the Space Shuttle Program.

title: Voyager 2 Closest Approach to Jupiter
description: Voyager 2 made its closest approach to Jupiter, capturing high-resolution images and data.

title: Telstar 1 Launched
description: Telstar 1 was launched, becoming the first communications satellite to relay television images.

title: Skylab Reenters Earth’s Atmosphere
description: NASA’s first space station Skylab reentered Earth's atmosphere, with debris falling over Western Australia.

title: NEAR Shoemaker Mission Ends
description: NASA's NEAR Shoemaker spacecraft completed its extended mission after landing on asteroid Eros.

title: JWST First Images Released
description: NASA released the first full-color images from the James Webb Space Telescope, revealing the deepest infrared views of the universe.

title: New Horizons Flyby of Pluto
description: NASA's New Horizons spacecraft performed the first flyby of Pluto, sending back stunning images and data.

title: Apollo-Soyuz Docking
description: The US Apollo and Soviet Soyuz spacecraft docked in orbit, symbolizing international space cooperation.

title: Apollo 11 Launch
description: NASA launched Apollo 11, carrying Neil Armstrong, Buzz Aldrin, and Michael Collins toward the Moon.

title: Apollo-Soyuz Joint Mission Continues
description: Crew members from the US and USSR conducted joint experiments aboard the docked spacecraft.

title: Rakesh Sharma Begins Training
description: Indian Air Force pilot Rakesh Sharma began training for the Soyuz T-11 mission to space.

title: NASA's CAPSTONE Arrives in Lunar Orbit
description: CAPSTONE entered near-rectilinear halo orbit around the Moon, testing the path planned for Gateway.

title: First Human Moon Landing
description: Apollo 11’s Lunar Module 'Eagle' landed on the Moon and Neil Armstrong took the first human step.

title: Buzz Aldrin Joins Armstrong on Moon
description: Buzz Aldrin followed Armstrong onto the lunar surface, spending over 2 hours on the Moon.

title: Chandrayaan-2 Launched
description: ISRO launched its second lunar mission, Chandrayaan-2, aiming for a soft landing near the Moon’s south pole.

title: Hope Mars Mission Launch
description: UAE launched the Hope Mars Mission to study Martian atmosphere and climate.

title: Apollo 11 Returns to Earth
description: Apollo 11 safely splashed down in the Pacific Ocean, completing humanity’s first Moon landing mission.

title: Ariane 5 Launches Eutelsat Quantum
description: Europe launched its first software-defined satellite with flexible beam reconfiguration in orbit.

title: Apollo 15 Launch
description: NASA launched Apollo 15, the first mission to use the Lunar Roving Vehicle on the Moon.

title: ISRO Tests RLV Autonomous Landing
description: ISRO completed successful autonomous landing trials for its Reusable Launch Vehicle prototype.

title: First Solar Eclipse Photographed
description: The first image of a solar eclipse was captured on a daguerreotype plate in Sweden.

title: NASA Created by US Congress
description: The US Congress passed legislation establishing the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA).

title: Perseverance Rover Launched
description: NASA launched the Perseverance rover to Mars to explore Jezero Crater and search for signs of past life.

title: Apollo 15 Moonwalk Begins
description: Astronauts Dave Scott and Jim Irwin began the first of three moonwalks, deploying the lunar rover.

title: Launch of TIROS-2
description: NASA launched TIROS-2, the second weather satellite, enhancing meteorological observations.

title: Apollo 15 Lunar Rover Deployment
description: Apollo 15 astronauts used the Lunar Roving Vehicle on the Moon for the first time.

title: MESSENGER Launch
description: NASA launched MESSENGER to study Mercury's chemical composition, geology, and magnetic field.

title: Juno Launch
description: NASA's Juno spacecraft launched to study Jupiter's atmosphere and magnetic field.

title: Curiosity Rover Lands on Mars
description: NASA's Curiosity rover successfully landed on Mars to explore Gale Crater.

title: Vostok 2 Launch
description: Cosmonaut Gherman Titov orbited Earth for over a day aboard Vostok 2.

title: Launch of Advanced Composition Explorer (ACE)
description: NASA launched ACE to study particles of solar, interstellar, interplanetary, and galactic origins.

title: Genesis Launch
description: NASA's Genesis spacecraft launched to collect solar wind samples.

title: Luna 24 Launch
description: USSR launched Luna 24, the last mission to bring Moon samples back to Earth.

title: Luna 25 Launch
description: Russia launched Luna 25, aiming for a lunar south pole landing, but the mission failed.

title: Total Solar Eclipse
description: A total solar eclipse was visible across parts of Europe, the Middle East, and India.

title: Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter Launch
description: NASA launched MRO to study Mars' atmosphere and terrain from orbit.

title: Launch of Vostok 4
description: Cosmonaut Pavel Popovich orbited Earth aboard Vostok 4, flying in tandem with Vostok 3.

title: Launch of EchoStar XV
description: EchoStar XV communications satellite launched to provide services across the U.S.

title: Discoverer 14 Launch
description: First successful recovery of a film capsule from orbit by the Corona spy satellite program.

title: High-Altitude Parachute Jump
description: Joseph Kittinger set a record with a parachute jump from 102,800 feet, aiding space suit development.

title: Venera 7 Launch
description: USSR launched Venera 7, which later became the first spacecraft to transmit data from Venus' surface.

title: Discoverer 14 Capsule Recovery
description: First mid-air recovery of a film capsule returning from orbit, part of the Corona program.

title: Luna 25 Crash
description: Russia's Luna 25 spacecraft crashed on the Moon during descent.

title: Viking 1 Launch
description: NASA launched Viking 1 to Mars, which later became the first U.S. mission to land safely on Mars.

title: Gemini 5 Launch
description: NASA launched Gemini 5, achieving an eight-day mission to test long-duration spaceflight.

title: X-15 Flight 91
description: NASA's X-15 Flight 91 reached an altitude of 107.8 km, qualifying pilot Joseph Walker for astronaut wings.

title: Chandrayaan-3 Soft Landing
description: India's Chandrayaan-3 lander successfully touched down near the lunar south pole, marking a historic milestone.

title: Pluto Redefined as Dwarf Planet
description: The International Astronomical Union officially reclassified Pluto as a dwarf planet.

title: Voyager 2 Flyby of Neptune
description: NASA's Voyager 2 spacecraft made its closest approach to Neptune, sending back detailed images of the planet.

title: First African-American Woman in Space Training
description: NASA announced the selection of astronaut candidate group including Mae Jemison, who later became the first African-American woman in space.

title: Mars Closest to Earth in 60,000 Years
description: Mars made its closest approach to Earth in nearly 60,000 years, appearing extremely bright in the night sky.

title: Gemini 5 Splashdown
description: NASA's Gemini 5 mission successfully returned to Earth after an eight-day mission.

title: NASA Formed
description: The National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) was formally established by the United States.

title: STS-8 Launch
description: NASA launched STS-8, the first shuttle night launch and landing. Guion Bluford became the first African American in space.

title: Launch of Pioneer 11 to Saturn
description: NASA's Pioneer 11 became the first spacecraft to encounter Saturn, sending back valuable data.

title: Pioneer 11 Flyby of Saturn
description: NASA's Pioneer 11 made the first direct observations of Saturn, providing close-up images and data on its rings and moons.

title: MRO Discovers Mars' Lost Atmosphere
description: NASA's Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter provided evidence of Mars' ancient atmosphere loss through carbonate deposits.

title: Viking 2 Lands on Mars
description: NASA's Viking 2 successfully landed on Mars, conducting experiments and sending images of the Martian surface.

title: Vikram Lander Enters Sleep Mode
description: ISRO's Vikram lander entered sleep mode after performing a successful hop on the lunar surface.

title: Voyager 1 Launch
description: NASA launched Voyager 1 to explore the outer planets and interstellar space.

title: LADEE Launch
description: NASA's Lunar Atmosphere and Dust Environment Explorer (LADEE) was launched to study the Moon's exosphere.

title: GeoEye-1 Launch
description: The high-resolution Earth observation satellite GeoEye-1 was launched, enhancing geospatial imaging capabilities.

title: OSIRIS-REx Launch
description: NASA launched OSIRIS-REx to collect samples from asteroid Bennu and return them to Earth.

title: Venera 9 Launch
description: The USSR launched Venera 9, which later became the first spacecraft to send images from the surface of Venus.

title: LHC First Beam
description: CERN's Large Hadron Collider circulated its first beam, marking a milestone in particle physics.

title: ISEE-3 Reentry
description: NASA's International Sun-Earth Explorer 3 (ISEE-3) reentered Earth's vicinity after a mission studying solar winds.

title: Luna 2 Launch
description: The USSR launched Luna 2, which became the first human-made object to impact the Moon.

title: ISEE-3 Reentry
description: NASA's International Sun-Earth Explorer 3 (ISEE-3) reentered Earth's vicinity after a mission studying solar winds.

title: Luna 2 Impacts Moon
description: The USSR's Luna 2 became the first human-made object to impact the Moon's surface.

title: Zond 5 Launch
description: The USSR launched Zond 5, which later became the first spacecraft to orbit the Moon and return to Earth.

title: Ingenuity's 59th Flight
description: NASA's Ingenuity helicopter reached a record altitude of 20 meters during its 59th flight on Mars.

title: X-15 First Powered Flight
description: NASA's X-15 aircraft made its first powered flight, contributing to high-speed flight research.

title: Soyuz 38 Launch
description: The USSR launched Soyuz 38, carrying the first Cuban astronaut, Arnaldo Tamayo Méndez, into space.

title: Viking 2 Begins Surface Operations
description: NASA's Viking 2 lander began its surface operations on Mars, conducting experiments and sending images.

title: Luna 16 Returns Lunar Soil
description: The USSR's Luna 16 returned the first automatic soil samples from the Moon to Earth.

title: Galileo Mission Ends
description: NASA's Galileo spacecraft was intentionally deorbited into Jupiter's atmosphere, ending its mission.

title: Hinode Launch
description: The Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA) launched Hinode to study the Sun's magnetic fields and solar flares.

title: Mars Climate Orbiter Lost
description: NASA lost contact with the Mars Climate Orbiter due to a unit conversion error, causing it to disintegrate in Mars' atmosphere.

title: OSIRIS-REx Capsule Returns
description: NASA's OSIRIS-REx returned a sample capsule from asteroid Bennu to Earth, the first U.S. mission to collect asteroid samples.

title: Mars Observer Launch
description: NASA launched the Mars Observer to study the Martian surface, atmosphere, and magnetic field, though it was lost just before entering orbit.

title: Soyuz T-10-1 Launch Abort
description: The USSR successfully executed an emergency escape system that saved the crew seconds before the Soyuz T-10-1 rocket exploded on the launchpad.

title: Dawn Launch
description: NASA launched the Dawn spacecraft to study the asteroid Vesta and the dwarf planet Ceres.

title: SpaceX Falcon 1 Reaches Orbit
description: SpaceX's Falcon 1 became the first privately developed liquid-fueled rocket to reach Earth orbit.

title: Tiangong-1 Launch
description: China launched its first prototype space station, Tiangong-1, marking a major step in its space ambitions.

title: Soyuz 2 Launch
description: The USSR launched Soyuz 2 as part of a test mission; its docking plan with Soyuz 3 was not successful, but valuable rendezvous data was gathered.
